q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
h:
“Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Open your mind before your mouth.
h:
“Open your mind before your mouth.” —
Aristophanes

q: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
h:
“Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.” —
Carol Burnett

q: I'm not afraid of death, but I'm in no hurry to die.
h:
“I'm not afraid of death, but I'm in no hurry to die.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: Every day passes whether you participate or not.
h:
“Every day passes whether you participate or not.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: You cannot change your destination overnight but you can change your direction overnight.
h:
“You cannot change your destination overnight but you can change your direction overnight.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.
h:
“Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
h:
“Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
h:
“What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: We become brave by doing brave acts.
h:
“We become brave by doing brave acts.” —
Aristotle

q: No matter how much preparation we do, in the real tests of our lives, we'll be in unfamiliar terrain.
h:
“No matter how much preparation we do, in the real tests of our lives, we'll be in unfamiliar terrain.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
h:
“Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Be patient and calm; no one can catch fish in anger.
h:
“Be patient and calm; no one can catch fish in anger.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength.
h:
“Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Evil is whatever distracts.
h:
“Evil is whatever distracts. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have.
h:
“The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.
h:
“If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: We forge the chains we wear in life.
h:
“We forge the chains we wear in life.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
h:
“The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.” —
Carl Jung

q: Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.
h:
“Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Those who are enlightened never stop forging themselves.
h:
“Those who are enlightened never stop forging themselves.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
h:
“We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.
h:
“Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.” —
Thomas Jefferson
